intro: Isopogon uncinatus, commonly known as the hooked isopogon, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting nectar-feeding insects. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs. Isopogon uncinatus is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in coastal heathlands.
